tool_description: Helioviewer is an open-source project for the visualization of solar and heliospheric data, funded by ESA and NASA.
name: Helioviewer v1
title: Helioviewer v1

api_list.name: getTile
api_list.description:
Request a single image tile to be used in the Helioviewer.org Viewport.  Tiles are 512x512 pixel PNG images, generated for a given image scale from the intermediary JPEG2000 image files.

        Use the `getClosestImage` API endpoint to obtain the desired image identifier for the `id` parameter.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: Unique image identifier.

required_parameters.name: x
required_parameters.description: Tile position.

required_parameters.name: y
required_parameters.description: Tile position.

required_parameters.name: imageScale
required_parameters.description: Image scale in arcseconds per pixel.

api_list.name: checkYouTubeAuth
api_list.description: Check to see if Helioveiwer.org is authorized to interact with a user's YouTube account via the current browser session.

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

api_list.name: reQueueMovie
api_list.description: Re-generate a custom movie that is no longer cached on disk.  Once the movie has been successfully queued for regeneration, the Movie ID can be used to check on the status of the movie (via `getMovieStatus`) and to download the movie (via `downloadMovie`).

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: Unique movie identifier (provided by the response to a `queueMovie` request).

api_list.name: getDataSources
api_list.description:
Return a hierarchial list of the available datasources.

        Optional parameter `verbose` is exists for compatability with JHelioviewer.  It outputs the hierarchical list in an alternative format and limits the list of available datasources to a known set (SDO and SOHO).  JHelioviewer may not operate properly if new datasources appear in the feed without a client-side updgrade.  To explicitly include new sources, use the optional `enable` parameter.

optional_parameters.name: enable
optional_parameters.description: Comma-separated list of observatories to enable.

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

api_list.name: getClosestImage
api_list.description:
Find the image data that is closest to the requested date/time.  Return the associated metadata from the helioviewer database and the XML header of the JPEG2000 image file.

        Either `sourceId` must be specified, or the combination of `observatory`, `instrument`, `detector`, and `measurement`.

required_parameters.name: date
required_parameters.description: Desired date/time of the image. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

optional_parameters.name: sourceId
optional_parameters.description: Unique image datasource identifier.  Can be specified in lieu of the `observatory`, `instrument`, `detector`, and `measurement` parameters.

optional_parameters.name: observatory
optional_parameters.description: Observatory name.

optional_parameters.name: instrument
optional_parameters.description: Instrument name.

optional_parameters.name: detector
optional_parameters.description: Detector name.

optional_parameters.name: measurement
optional_parameters.description: Measurement name.

api_list.name: queueMovie
api_list.description: Create a custom movie by submitting a request to the movie generation queue.  The response returned will provide you with a unique Movie ID that can be used to check on the status of your movie (via `getMovieStatus`) and to download your movie (via `downloadMovie`).

required_parameters.name: startTime
required_parameters.description: Desired date and time of the first frame of the movie. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

required_parameters.name: endTime
required_parameters.description: Desired date and time of the final frame of the movie. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

required_parameters.name: layers
required_parameters.description: Image datasource layer(s) to include in the movie.

required_parameters.name: events
required_parameters.description: List feature/event types and FRMs to use to annoate the movie.  Use the empty string to indicate that no feature/event annotations should be shown.

required_parameters.name: eventsLabels
required_parameters.description: Optionally annotate each event marker with a text label.

required_parameters.name: imageScale
required_parameters.description: Image scale in arcseconds per pixel.

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Movie format (`mp4`, `webm`, `flv`). Default value is `mp4`.

optional_parameters.name: frameRate
optional_parameters.description: Movie frames per second.  15 frames per second by default.

optional_parameters.name: maxFrames
optional_parameters.description: Maximum number of frames in the movie.  May be capped by the server.

optional_parameters.name: scale
optional_parameters.description: Optionally overlay an image scale indicator.

optional_parameters.name: scaleType
optional_parameters.description: Image scale indicator.

optional_parameters.name: scaleX
optional_parameters.description: Horizontal offset of the image scale indicator in arcseconds with respect to the center of the Sun.

optional_parameters.name: scaleY
optional_parameters.description: Vertical offset of the image scale indicator in arcseconds with respect to the center of the Sun.

optional_parameters.name: movieLength
optional_parameters.description: Movie length in seconds.

optional_parameters.name: watermark
optional_parameters.description: Optionally overlay a Helioviewer.org watermark image.  Enabled by default.

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Width of the field of view in pixels. (Used in conjunction width `x0`,`y0`, and `height`).

optional_parameters.name: height
optional_parameters.description: Height of the field of view in pixels. (Used in conjunction width `x0`,`y0`, and `width`).

optional_parameters.name: x0
optional_parameters.description: The horizontal offset of the center of the field of view from the center of the Sun.  Used in conjunction with `y0`, `width`, and `height`.

optional_parameters.name: y0
optional_parameters.description: The vertical offset of the center of the field of view from the center of the Sun.  Used in conjunction with `x0`, `width`, and `height`.

optional_parameters.name: x1
optional_parameters.description: The horizontal offset of the top-left corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `y1`, `x2`, and `y2`.

optional_parameters.name: y1
optional_parameters.description: The vertical offset of the top-left corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `x1`, `x2`, and `y2`.

optional_parameters.name: x2
optional_parameters.description: The horizontal offset of the bottom-right corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `x1`, `y1`, and `y2`.

optional_parameters.name: y2
optional_parameters.description: The vertical offset of the bottom-right corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `x1`, `y1`, and `x2`.

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

api_list.name: shortenURL
api_list.description: Shorten a Helioviewer.org URL with the bit.ly URL shortening web service.

required_parameters.name: queryString
required_parameters.description: URL-encoded query string.

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

api_list.name: uploadMovieToYouTube
api_list.description: Share an existing user-generated movie to YouTube.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: Unique movie identifier (provided by the response to a `queueMovie` request).

optional_parameters.name: title
optional_parameters.description: Movie title.

optional_parameters.name: description
optional_parameters.description: Move description.
optional_parameters.default: This movie was produced by Helioviewer.org. See the original at http://helioviewer.org/?movieId=y9tX5 or download a high-quality version from http://helioviewer.org/api/?action=downloadMovie&id=y9tX5&format=mp4&hq=true

optional_parameters.name: tags
optional_parameters.description: Movie keyword tags (comma separated).

optional_parameters.name: share
optional_parameters.description: Optionally share the movie with the Helioviewer community.

optional_parameters.name: html
optional_parameters.description: Optionally output response as HTML instead of JSON.

api_list.name: downloadMovie
api_list.description: Download a custom movie in one of three file formats.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: Unique movie identifier (provided by the response to a `queueMovie` request).

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: Movie Format (`mp4`, `webm`, or `flv`).

optional_parameters.name: hq
optional_parameters.description: Optionally download a higher-quality movie file (valid for .mp4 movies only, ignored otherwise).

api_list.name: downloadScreenshot
api_list.description: Download a custom screenshot (that was generated using the `takeScreenshot` API endpoint).

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: Unique screenshot identifier (provided by the response to a `takeScreenshot` request).

api_list.name: getYouTubeAuth
api_list.description: Request authorization from the user via a Google / YouTube authorization flow to permit Helioviewer to upload videos on behalf of the user.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: Unique movie identifier (provided by the response to a `queueMovie` request).

required_parameters.name: title
required_parameters.description: Movie title.

required_parameters.name: description
required_parameters.description: Move description.
required_parameters.default: This movie was produced by Helioviewer.org. See the original at http://helioviewer.org/?movieId=z6vX5 or download a high-quality version from http://helioviewer.org/api/?action=downloadMovie&id=z6vX5&format=mp4&hq=true

required_parameters.name: tags
required_parameters.description: Movie keyword tags (comma separated).

optional_parameters.name: share
optional_parameters.description: Optionally share the movie with the Helioviewer community.

api_list.name: playMovie
api_list.description: Output an HTML web page with the requested movie embedded within.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: Unique movie identifier (provided by the response to a `queueMovie` request).

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: Movie format (mp4, webm, or flv).

required_parameters.name: height
required_parameters.description: Height of embedded movie player in pixels. Defaults to the actual height of the movie itself.

optional_parameters.name: hq
optional_parameters.description: Optionally download a higher-quality movie file (valid for .mp4 movies only, ignored otherwise).

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Width of embedded movie player in pixels.  Defaults to the actual width of the movie itself.

api_list.name: takeScreenshot
api_list.description:
Generate a custom screenshot.

        You must specify values for either `x1`, `y1`, `x2`, and `y2`
        or `x0`, `y0`, `width` and `height`.

        By default, the response is a JSON object containing a unique screenshot identifier (`id`) that can be used to with the `downloadScreenshot` API endpoint.

        Set the `display` parameter to `true` to directly return the screenshot as binary PNG image data in the response.

        Please note that each request causes the server to generate a screenshot from scratch and is resource intensive.  For performance reasons, you should cache the response if you simply intend to serve exactly the same screenshot to multiple users.

required_parameters.name: date
required_parameters.description: Desired date/time of the image. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

required_parameters.name: imageScale
required_parameters.description: Image scale in arcseconds per pixel.

required_parameters.name: layers
required_parameters.description: Image datasource layer(s) to include in the screenshot.

required_parameters.name: eventLabels
required_parameters.description: Optionally annotate each event marker with a text label.

optional_parameters.name: events
optional_parameters.description: List feature/event types and FRMs to use to annoate the movie.  Use the empty string to indicate that no feature/event annotations should be shown.

optional_parameters.name: scale
optional_parameters.description: Optionally overlay an image scale indicator.

optional_parameters.name: scaleType
optional_parameters.description: Image scale indicator.

optional_parameters.name: scaleX
optional_parameters.description: Horizontal offset of the image scale indicator in arcseconds with respect to the center of the Sun.

optional_parameters.name: scaleY
optional_parameters.description: Vertical offset of the image scale indicator in arcseconds with respect to the center of the Sun.

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Width of the field of view in pixels. (Used in conjunction width `x0`,`y0`, and `height`).

optional_parameters.name: height
optional_parameters.description: Height of the field of view in pixels. (Used in conjunction width `x0`,`y0`, and `width`).

optional_parameters.name: x0
optional_parameters.description: The horizontal offset of the center of the field of view from the center of the Sun.  Used in conjunction with `y0`, `width`, and `height`.

optional_parameters.name: y0
optional_parameters.description: The vertical offset of the center of the field of view from the center of the Sun.  Used in conjunction with `x0`, `width`, and `height`.

optional_parameters.name: x1
optional_parameters.description: The horizontal offset of the top-left corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `y1`, `x2`, and `y2`.

optional_parameters.name: y1
optional_parameters.description: The vertical offset of the top-left corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `x1`, `x2`, and `y2`.

optional_parameters.name: x2
optional_parameters.description: The horizontal offset of the bottom-right corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `x1`, `y1`, and `y2`.

optional_parameters.name: y2
optional_parameters.description: The vertical offset of the bottom-right corner of the field of view with respect to the center of the Sun (in arcseconds). Used in conjunction with `x1`, `y1`, and `x2`.

optional_parameters.name: display
optional_parameters.description: Set to `true` to directly output binary PNG image data.  Default is `false` (which outputs a JSON object).

optional_parameters.name: watermark
optional_parameters.description: Optionally overlay a watermark consisting of a Helioviewer logo and the datasource abbreviation(s) and timestamp(s) displayed in the screenshot.

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

api_list.name: getNewsFeed
api_list.description: Get the XML RSS feed of the official Helioviewer Project Blog.

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

api_list.name: getUserVideos
api_list.description: Get a listing (in descending time order) of the most recently user-generated movies that have been publicly shared to YouTube.  Result set is limited to the value requested or default value of the `num` parameter (unless truncated when the date value of the `since` parameter is reached).

optional_parameters.name: num
optional_parameters.description: Number of shared user-generated movies to include in the response.  Default is 10.

optional_parameters.name: since
optional_parameters.description: Optionally truncate result set if this date/time is reached.  ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

optional_parameters.name: force
optional_parameters.description: Optionally bypass cache to retrieve most up-to-date data.

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

api_list.name: getJP2Header
api_list.description: Get the XML header embedded in a JPEG2000 image. Includes the FITS header as well as a section of Helioviewer-specific metadata.

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: Unique JP2 image identifier.

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.

api_list.name: getJP2Image
api_list.description:
Download a JP2 image for the specified datasource that is the closest match in time to the `date` requested.

        Either `sourceId` must be specified, or the combination of `observatory`, `instrument`, `detector`, and `measurement`.

required_parameters.name: date
required_parameters.description: Desired date/time of the JP2 image. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

optional_parameters.name: sourceId
optional_parameters.description: Unique image datasource identifier.

optional_parameters.name: observatory
optional_parameters.description: Observatory name.

optional_parameters.name: instrument
optional_parameters.description: Instrument name.

optional_parameters.name: detector
optional_parameters.description: Detector name.

optional_parameters.name: measurement
optional_parameters.description: Measurement name.

optional_parameters.name: jpip
optional_parameters.description: Optionally return a JPIP URI instead of the binary data of the image itself.

optional_parameters.name: json
optional_parameters.description: Optionally return a JSON object.

api_list.name: getJPX
api_list.description:
Generate and (optionally) download a custom JPX movie of the specified datasource.

        Either `sourceId` must be specified, or the combination of `observatory`, `instrument`, `detector`, and `measurement`.

required_parameters.name: startTime
required_parameters.description: Date/Time for the beginning of the JPX movie data. ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

required_parameters.name: endTime
required_parameters.description: Date/Time for the end of the JPX movie data.  ISO 8601 combined UTC date and time UTC format.

optional_parameters.name: measurement
optional_parameters.description: Measurement name.

optional_parameters.name: sourceId
optional_parameters.description: Unique image datasource identifier.  Can be specified in lieu of the `observatory`, `instrument`, `detector`, and `measurement` parameters.

optional_parameters.name: observatory
optional_parameters.description: Observatory name.

optional_parameters.name: instrument
optional_parameters.description: Instrument name.

optional_parameters.name: detector
optional_parameters.description: Detector name.

optional_parameters.name: linked
optional_parameters.description: Generate a `linked` JPX file containing image pointers instead of data for each individual frame in the series. Currently, only JPX image series support this feature.

optional_parameters.name: verbose
optional_parameters.description: If set to `true,` the JSON response will include timestamps for each frame in the resulting movie and any warning messages associated with the request, in addition to the JPX movie file URI.

optional_parameters.name: jpip
optional_parameters.description: Optionally return a JPIP URI string instead of the binary data of the movie itself, or instead of an HTTP URI in the JSON response (if `verbose` is set to `true`).

optional_parameters.name: cadence
optional_parameters.description:
The desired amount of time (in seconds) between each frame in the movie.

                If no cadence is specified, the server will attempt to select an optimal cadence.

api_list.name: getMovieStatus

required_parameters.name: id
required_parameters.description: Unique movie identifier (provided by the response to a `queueMovie` request).

required_parameters.name: format
required_parameters.description: Movie format (`mp4`, `webm`, or `flv`).

optional_parameters.name: verbose
optional_parameters.description: Optionally include extra metadata in the response.

optional_parameters.name: callback
optional_parameters.description: Wrap the response object in a function call of your choosing.
